title: Great idea, but aggravating implementation
text: This is a great concept, but seems to be geared around people with cars. If you need to spend $5+ on transit or take 20m getting there, it will cancel out the discount you may receive. The minimum search radius is 2 miles, and that’ll cover Manhattan and into New Jersey and Brooklyn. And then there is no way to sort or filter the results, say by distance or time/availability. Would love to see these or “view on a map.”

title: Good Budget Option
text:
I am in Chicago, so there are a lot of decent options near me. I appreciate the ratings, especially for the grocery stores, as I tend to assume they got rated harshly for expired items or poor value for the price.

A couple areas of potential improvement: I wish there were more stores near me. Most of the stores are coffee shops, so the food is primarily bread and pastries.

Another thing that would be nice is to be able to leave more information in the review and see other people’s reviews. However, I understand this might be hard to moderate. 

Really, I am just trying to get a general feel of what exactly I might be picking up (ex: croissants and muffins vs. more substantial food) and want to know if anyone got food poisoning or moldy food before.

Overall, love the mission and appreciate the chance to get some lower priced food!

title: Another idea to try out
text: This app is amazing and what its doing is as well but you know what I think would make it 100% 5 star is if you could put in a destination like I am driving here at this time and that way it can show you the bags you could save along the way. Like you get off work and drive home at this time why not pick these bags up to save? I would do it a lot more often and just have surprise dinners or snacks for after dinner. Would be a cool set up is all.

title: Orders ALWAYS cancelled
text:
I’ve tried to make an order through this app six times and four have gotten cancelled. I don’t know if it’s the app’s fault but these sellers in the Seattle area need to be held accountable. If they don’t have surplus food, they should not be advertising that they do. I don’t get the notification that my food has been cancelled until an hour before it should be ready for pick up, which is a major inconvenience because I planned my day around that.

 Another thing I noticed is a lot of sellers aren’t actually selling surplus food. I saw one restaurant owner handing us food from the same pile he used to sell another customer food who wasn’t there to collect surplus.

title: Needs more dietary preferences
text: Love the message and purpose of this app, and love the prices even more. My only issue is that there doesn’t seem to be many options in the dietary restrictions section aside from “vegetarian” or “vegan”. Wish there was a way to omit foods one might have allergies or sensitivities to as well. I can’t eat pork because it hurts my stomach, but I’m able to eat everything else. Unfortunately, the only way to make sure my meal won’t contain pork is by choosing the vegetarian option, which usually leaves me with barely any options.

title: Great concept and Delicious food!
text: I love everything about this app! This app makes it easy and simple to choose from places near by and for a great value too. I will warn those with allergens that you don’t know what you’re getting so be alert when picking up your food. Other than that I recommend this app for those who aren’t picky and love trying new food! 10/10. This app definitely needs more recognition!

title: Focus on dietary needs
text: If you have food allergies/sensitivities or dietary needs, the selection is extremely small or difficult to navigate. In the San Francisco Bay Area, there are all of TWO vegan vendors. Granted, the app just had its official launch here somewhat recently, but not being able to communicate your dietary needs prior to ordering a surprise bag seems like a miss. At least allow for this option at vendors who are willing to accommodate (e.g., vegetarian vendors would likely have very little concerns about accommodating vegans). That way the pickup is less awkward for both parties.

title: Such a great concept!
text: We are having so much fun with this app and scoring awesome surprise food bags! So far, we have tried the Panera grab bags a couple times and we just ordered some from our favorite local store, The Chocolate Shoppe. It’s fun being surprised and getting to try out new items you might not usually gravitate towards on your own! Plus, the deals are awesome and who can’t use a price break during these times of high inflation!

title: The best app ever
text: No lie. This is the most important app I never knew I needed. I am so happy to eat quality food at such a discount while at the same time belonging fight food waste. These developers are brilliant. I am going to be forever a fan. For instance, I got delicious food that would’ve normally costed me $23 for $6. Admittedly, I get a high off saving money and getting a deal so that is in play as well. Regardless, it’s a win win for everybody and the element of surprise is quite fun.

title: This apps is soo good
text: This is my first time to write the review for the apps. I really love this and believes they deserve for 5 stars. However, I just curious why it doesn’t have the notification show up when my favorite stores start to have to sale for today. I turned the notification on, but I never get any notification. It always too late for me to find out the sale gone few minutes ago :(. Not sure if I miss any steps to set the notification on.

title: Nice enough if it works, which it rarely does.
text: This was a cute idea but recently it’s become a crap shoot as to whether or not the restaurant will have the food you paid for or even still participate in the program. You got a 40% chance of getting food and not having your time wasted. It might be worth it if 2good2go took action when vendors close early, don’t have food or ignore the program entirely, but they don’t. They’ll apologize and every refund your money for the service they failed to provide. No longer worth the time and effort, sorry I sold them so much of my data.

title: Good But Needs More Participation
text: The apps message is great. I only have gotten one bag so far and it’s actually because my favorite bagel place participated and they gave me 2 dozen bagels! In my area at least not many restaurants participate I wish more would heed the message. One thing to note is that it does depend on the restaurant itself how much you get as some restaurants give you more some give you less depending on how generous they are.

userName: i'll be sitting next to you!
title: Great opportunity!
text: Too Good to Go presents you with some unique opportunities:  you get to try the food at a restaurant or market, paying only 1/3 of the regular prices, AND you save food from being wasted!  If the food was otherwise going to City Harvest or another food-gathering and distribution organization, I might feel differently.  But the restaurants don’t have that much food to make pick-ups cost-efficient.  So Too Good to Go fills that niche!

title: Disappointed
text: I wanted a refund because I was taken to the middle of a highway with the location for the restaurant and then there was no phone number. When I reached out for help with a refund and letting them know this place has incorrect information, I received no help of any kind and no hope that anything would be done to spare others of wasting their time and energy as I have. I’ve also received food with mold on another occasion. I have only had one good experience out of three but at least I was refunded for the mold experience. I’m just very disappointed because this concept could be a good one if it was well managed.

title: Wildly convenient, cheap, and necessary
text:
I thought this would be too good to be true, but I just did my first order pickup… and this is indeed as amazing as it sounds. 

- 75%+ discounted, perfectly good food?
- Last-minute sales for local shops?
- Food (and plastic containers) that would’ve gone in the trash otherwise?
- And in an incredibly easy, slick, communicative app?

Food waste is apparently a huge chunk of global warming—that alone makes this a great idea. But it also just feels great. 

How many evenings do how many people truly not care much about what they have for supper? I’m frequently one of them, and can’t wait to use this app regularly. Cheap, easy, preventing waste—doesn’t get any better. 

Heading home now to enjoy this (*checks receipt*) 80%-off chocolate ice cream.

title: Terrible customer service, great concept
text: I’ve been a regular user of this app, but my last experience was absolutely terrible. I had arrived and had picked up my food in a TRASH BAG. I had seen the employee use dirty hands to place food in as well, and ended up not eating our meal because of how unsanitary it was. I reached out to customer service and shared a photo, but they informed me that they couldn’t do anything other than offer me a voucher. I still haven’t received the voucher and it’s been over two weeks. I have tried consistently reaching out, and no one has replied. So disappointed and will not use again until their internal ops are decent.

title: Why I’m deleting this app
text: The company says they are all about rescuing food. They are lying to you. I went on the app at 4:29 to rescue two meals. I put them in my cart and proceeded to check out. The clock hit 4:30 before I could finish and my transaction was blocked. If they really cared about saving the food from the dump, my transaction would have gone through. Instead two meals went into the trash. Such a shame.

title: Yum!
text: Just discovered this app and I’m amazed. Love the concept and participation by the restaurants! Sadly, there are not many places in our area, but the 2 I’ve been to, which are the same store but different locations, have been awesome! It’s wonderful to be able to enjoy goodies from restaurants (esp bakeries) a little more often because it’s way more affordable this way. And we’re all glad the foods not just getting dumped.

title: Best app ever!
text: I was worried that this would be a hassle to use or not worth the money, but it’s worth every penny! You pick your store, they tell you what time to come in, and they have bag ready for you with (at least) three times what you paid for! For example, got 3 boba teas for $5. A convenience store gave me eggs, bread, a large container of yogurt, a small container of yogurt, and spicy cashews for $5. Now I’m obsessed and want to try every store near me!

title: Please make career paths for Seattle,Wa!
text:
Love this app, this mission is very near and dear to my heart. 10/10 on the food, variety and quantity. This make it so easy to fight food waste!! 
 I’m currently working towards an AAB with an environmental science certificate and would absolutely love to join this team of superhero’s! Unfortunately there are no career paths in my area, I look forward to seeing them expand and hopefully joining in the fight for a better Earth and more responsible consumption!
-Hannah

title: Great idea, mixed bag
text:
Great idea and good app. Intuitive, good search options. Would really love to read the comments behind the ratings tho. A star and selection of four categories doesn’t tell you much. 

I’m in Manhattan and have had mixed results. Two grocery stores provided food that went bad the next day and one place had no idea why I was there. But I got a nice assortment from a gourmet market for $5 and a friend got a big salad and amazing pastries from somewhere else.  Not much variety tho. Mostly bakeries, bagel shops and pizza joints. 

I also have to wonder how much food some of these places are actually saving. A couple of places were listed as having “only 2 bags left” still had a of sandwiches and fresh salad ingredients behind the counter and I gotta believe that most of it was going to go bad within a day.  

So worth the effort but a need for quality control

title: Great concept but restaurants made it into something else entirely
text:
When the app started, it was great! I loved being able to go on the app and check out what restaurants had available the day of that was just going to be thrown out and just getting something I wouldn’t have thought to try if we ordered regular takeout

Now whenever I check for what’s available, everything’s just for pickup tomorrow. So instead of ending food waste, seems like now it’s just an app where I can put in an order a day in advance

title: Wish it had better notifications
text: First of all, I love this app! I use it all the time. However, I wish the app alerted you when the restaurants/stores in your favorites became available. I have to periodically check if anything from my favorites list is available and I often miss the small window. Please update this app to have a more efficient notification system so we’re actually being alerted when our favorites are available.

title: Daddy O’s Rancho Cordova
text:
My GrandDaughter called to tell me about a BBQ Rest in Rancho Cordova, she and her husband had heard about and wanting to try out since they moved here from Mid-SAC.  I checked them out, So I tried:        
1)  3-Hot Links, Mac n’Cheese & Collard Greens
2)  Chicken thigh & drumstick w/same two sides.  I’d bever had “greens” before, but, I’ll neva miss out on them again.  Deliciously prepared food❣️ Very hospitable greeting and quick to go Service❣️ I can hardly wait to go back.  ENJOY!!!

title: Best app ever
text: You get food for cheaper, help fight food waste, and help store owners make a little extra money on things that would be thrown away. I wish there were more options, but I feel like more and more have been added. The only problem is when you find a shop that you love, and end up spending money bc you have to have their food even without the discount hahah

title: Amazing concept!
text: I loved this concept where there is a win win for both the parties! The restaurants and store owners can sell the leftover (yet good quality food) without discarding it or throwing it away and the customers can buy it at a discounted price! The quantity that some restaurants give is so much that you’re good for 1-2 days and can even give it away to people in need! Love the fact that we are reducing food wastage.

title: Great idea! Easy to use and fun.
text: The app is easy to use and has good variety. I only wish they were in more areas so I could use them when I’m away or visiting relatives out of town. I’m in NYC though and there’s plenty of options walking distance from me. Other than that, I can’t think of a single negative to this app. I helped a local business, reduced food waste, and got a delicious dessert for a reduced price.

title: Restaurants are always closed when I arrive
text: Really sad to say this because I really agree with what you all are doing but for two days in a row I’ve arrived to the restaurant at my pick up time and the place has been closed. This is a huge waste of my time because it means I’ve not only wasted my time traveling to the destination, but I also have to spend more time/money coming up with an alternative plan so I’d say this app has actually cost me. This is also really brought down my trust with this app and am not sure I will continue using unless you resolve this.

title: App Continually Crashes
text:
The app continually crashes, making it a frustrating experience to try to find a place to order from.

The available offerings in San Francisco are not that great and the availability is very poor even if one checks the app multiple times throughout the day. I suspect that many places signed up for the free first month and then decided not to continue participating.

If you are a poor person who has a lot of free time, this app might work for you. However, for the amount of time wasted trying to use an app that crashes all the time and checking for availability, one would be better off just paying full price and going to pick up the food at a time of one's own choosing.

Honestly using this app just feels like dumpster diving. It's cool if that's your thing and it's an interesting business model, but I think once the novelty wears off the user base will be somewhat limited.

title: Good Idea, App needs some tweaking
text: Love the idea of this - but the app itself needs some fine tuning. Choosing a circular radius doesn’t work well if you live near the Hudson - no one is crossing the bridge to pick up a discount bag. There should be a way to screen out places that you know you aren’t interested in and perhaps get an alert when a favorite spot posts available bags. I realize it’s a work in progress and I hope it keeps growing - it might grow faster if they looked at feedback from their current users.

title: False notifications
text:
I downloaded this app because I loved the idea behind it. Unfortunately there are no stores in my area participating (yet), but the app said they would notify me when it became available. So I left the app on my phone just in case. 

Now I receive notifications regularly saying that stores have opened up near me, only to open the app and find that’s still not true. I can’t comment on the quality of the app/service when it actually is available in your area, but I do not recommend keeping the app on your phone if it’s not.

title: Needs notifications
text:
Solid concept but I don’t understand how to set up notifications. I’ve set my favorites but unless I check this app a half a dozen times throughout the day (and even with that) I can’t seem to get the locations that make sense for me. 

Please add notifications at least for the restaurant(s) that we add as favorites.

This is a great initiative but I don’t get to participate as often as I would like.

title: Wrong times
text:
Wasted gas and time to get an order from 5-6pm inside a farmers market. Found out from the other shops inside my store(Stolzfus Family Foods), they closed at 4pm and no one was there. To rub even more salt into the wound my order was “delivered”. 

Look I understand this app is part of a good cause but if the restaurants on here are irresponsible, then I might have second thoughts promoting this app to anyone if I’m gonna be gaslit like this.

title: such a wonderful idea!! can’t wait for it to grow
text:
I love this idea so much. selling for low cost the food waste at markets and restaurants. it’s genius and a wonderful resource. one upgrade i’d love to see is getting notifications when places you favorite open their reservations for the surprise bags. some places put them out at different times and I feel too late on a lot of places. 
overall, I love this app and will continue to use it. thanks!

title: Pleased User
text: I absolutely LOOOVE using this app! It has turned me on to some good spots I now frequent without the app, sometimes you want fresh haha. I also feel good about helping with waste although I have had a couple of places where it’s evident they’re literally giving you what was about to go in trash. You learn & stay away from those. Over all ecstatic user who tells everyone about it!!

title: Love the business but not the app
text:
This is a really neat way to reduce food waste. My gripe is about notifications: I would love to know when things become available at specific stores, but this isn’t an option. Relatedly I don’t want notifications from places I haven’t designated as favorites. 
The new update seems to have removed information about when a place sells out their bags, which I miss as it helped me know when to check the app. 
Good luck to the app and developers and thanks for this pipeline

title: Fun app!
text:
Value is hit or miss Ie got two rice items come on, don’t try to cheap out and make money on this!  There is no way what they give is worth 2/3 what they r asking.  Vendors should to happy to participate by 1. Goals of the app lessening food waste and 2. Basically free advertising to often obscure mom and pops. Otherwise we would never known you were there. 

The pastry and donut shops r very generous.
Otherwise, having fun on the treasure hunt.

title: Eat well, save money, prevent food waste
text: We’re enjoying this app- it’s easy to use, and clear rating system and photos help us make decisions on what to get. I hope more restaurants get on this app. We’ve gotten salmon and baked goods. I like the map feature- and ability to search by location. We star our favorites, so it’s quick to check in everyday without scrolling much.

title: There are kosher options in NYC!
text: I am very passionate about food rescue and was excited to download and try it out, but the problem with magic bags as a kosher-observant person is groceries don’t necessarily work out, and I would only be able to reliably get prepared food form a kosher restaurant. I was thrilled to see that there was at least 1 kosher restaurant participating in my area of New York City! You can keep kosher and rescue food! Great app experience.

title: More restaurants!
text:
The UI is very good. I can filter for things, even vegetarian, easily in a list or map. The payment experience was also seamless.

I just wish there were more restaurants! I know this is ultimately a decision of the restaurant, not the app devs, but that is the only thing I’d want to see changed in this app. I noticed there are a lot of bakeries opted in, but it would be nice if there were more lunch/dinner meal places.

title: Support needs work
text:
I have some questions about order pickups, but am not able to contact support to ask them. In the app, the choices I get are not relevant to what I want. There is no phone number nor email that I can find on the website. This seems to be the only way to get a response.
My question is: can I only pick up food at the times shown? Or can I go at anytime once I place an order.
I have heard great things from people who have used the app and am eager to try it.
Thank you
Fred Tubello

title: Great money saver
text:
Admittedly you may need to drive a bit to get somewhere to use but living in Chicago I don’t have to drive much out of my way.    My finances don’t allow me to eat out much so this is novel and I can use the extra time focus on other important things then cooking and shopping.  Im not a picky eater either.   

It’s a win win for the environment so long as you don’t drive to far to get your food.

title: Genius Idea, Win-Win Concept
text: This is such a great idea! The reality of how much food is wasted/discarded makes me super sad, and I think this is a great way to mitigate that. And the discount I got on my favorite vegan cheese was just incredible. I hope more businesses partner with the app - the only shortcoming at the moment is there are just a couple local spots that I’m interested in at the moment. I’ve become an evangelist for Too Good to Go though!

title: Great concept & execution
text: This is a great concept and simple, easy to use app! My one lament is that I don’t have more restaurants in my area participating. For $5 I got a plateful of Thai food and pick up was as easy as walking in, showing the app, and heading out. I think it gives businesses exposure as well; I had never heard of this restaurant prior to ordering a TGTG bag, and based on what I ate I would be open to trying them again.

title: Great! But…
text: I love this app for the idea, and I love it for when it works out, but there were a couple errors. Once I went to pick up an order and the store said “we don’t take orders from this app anymore.” So had to request for refund. Then just now, I walked a few blocks to pick up an order, but the restaurant was closed. Now have to request for a refund again… now I feel like I’m scared to order again because the store might be closed and I had wasted hours waiting for my pick up time!

title: Amazing app, amazing idea…
text:
I think especially caffès, bakeries, 5 star hotels that serves open buffet type of breakfast, lunch, dinner, brunches , pizza joints…will have a better chance.. 
I love it is called a surprise bag and u never know and it is a surprise what to get every time.. 
 i wish we have more variety in our neighborhood..residents of Miami Beach and South beach area will have more fun.. because of many types of variety 👍🏼❤️❤️❤️that’s for sure..

title: Great app
text: I was waiting for the app to branch out to Long Island, now that it has it’s just as great as I thought it would be- better even. I’ve done 2 so far, pick ups are super clean and not awkward at all. The value has been crazy, one pick up was for 7 from a bakery, I got 11 donuts. Another was from a pizzeria for 6, I got 6 slices of pizza. Great app, I just wish we could write reviews for the restaurants.

title: I am a huge supporter of no waste!
text:
As a New Yorker and someone who had worked in the restaurant industry I have seen lots of waste . 

The majority of people in NYC are FOOD INSECURE. This app saves perfectly great food that would just be thrown away. I was so GRATEFUL to see what I received. 

Usually I’ve heard places donating to food banks /pantries or soup kitchens but this app makes it easily accessible to get a hot meal. TBH this pandemic it’s been hard and I know just like me , others are very grateful to use TooGoodToGo!

title: Pleasantly surprised, discovered new place
text: Finally used the app and we were pleasantly surprised by the ease of use and thrilled with the inclusion of smaller businesses like Bootes. This was our first purchase and in the process we discovered a new favorite cafe in Marbella’s Old Town, Casco Antiguo. We were early since we wanted to check out the cafe and enjoyed drinks and shared a quesadilla while waiting for Blanca to prepare a fresh fruit shake and fabulous tuna bowl as our “Too good to go” pack.

title: Wonderful app
text:
I gave a four-star rating. It would have been five stars except that I am diabetic, and most of the available restaurants are pizzerias or bagel shops and so don’t work for me. Still, it’s brilliant. 

My actual reason for the review is to suggest another city. I have many, many friends and family in Columbus, Ohio, and I have told them about this app. They are also jealous that it is not available there. Please consider expanding to that area.
